duties_responsibilities.duty: Design and optimize processes required to manufacture new medical devices.
Identify and evaluate innovative processing options based on product attributes, including evaluation based on technical and economic feasibility.
Execute cost-effective systems to enhance processing speed and quality, ensuring compliance with government regulations and industry standards.
Collaborate with R&D, Operations, and Production engineering to ensure effective completion of activities associated with transfer to manufacturing.
Compare costs and benefits when choosing product in-house or supplier selection.
Define, identify, and procure new equipment for manufacturing processes.
Adhere to Quality Management System and regulatory requirements, maintaining all training and seeking out opportunities for continuous development and growth.
Effectively work and interact with others throughout various levels of the global organization, strictly adhering to safety requirements.

education_certification.credential: PhD, MS, or Bachelor's degree in Engineering, or Engineering Technology with experience in process development, process validation, and lean manufacturing principles. Minimum of three years experience working in Class II/III medical device manufacturing or GMP regulated environment.
